/hr/ghcr.io-bjw-s-helm-app-template-k8s-.title: k8s-gateway helm release
/hr/ghcr.io-bjw-s-helm-app-template-k8s-.name: k8s-gateway
/hr/ghcr.io-bjw-s-helm-app-template-k8s-.doc:
k8s_gateway is a CoreDNS plugin that resolves all types of external Kubernetes resources.

It will gather all domains from all services, ingresses, and HTTPRoutes resources and create a DNS record for each of them, corresponding to the service IPs. This ensures that all external resources are resolved from within the cluster, and traffic is not leaving the cluster.

Most people deploy the k8s_gateway together with CoreDNS and call the Helm Release 'k8s-gateway'. This can be supplimenting along side the kube-dns or default CoreDNS from k3s.

0:
- name: TZ
  value: "${TIMEZONE}"
- name: JAVA_OPTS_APPEND
  value: "-Djgroups.dns.query=keycloak-headless"
- name: KC_PROXY
  value: edge
- name: KC_HTTP_ENABLED
  value: "true"
- name: KC_HOSTNAME
  value: id.${DOMAIN_1}
- name: KC_HOSTNAME_STRICT
  value: "true"
- name: KC_HOSTNAME_STRICT_HTTPS
  value: "true"
- name: KC_LOG_LEVEL
  value: "org.keycloak.events:DEBUG,org.infinispan:INFO,org.jgroups:INFO"
- name: KEYCLOAK_ADMIN
  value: "${KEYCLOAK_ADMIN_USER}"
- name: KEYCLOAK_ADMIN_PASSWORD
  value: "${KEYCLOAK_ADMIN_PASS}"

# - name: QUARKUS_TRANSACTION_MANAGER_ENABLE_RECOVERY
#   value: "true"

# - name: KC_HTTPS_TRUST_STORE_PASSWORD
#   value: password
# - name: KC_HTTPS_CLIENT_AUTH
#   value: request
1:
- name: KEYCLOAK_ADMIN
  valueFrom:
    secretKeyRef:
      name: keycloak-credentials
      key: user
- name: KEYCLOAK_ADMIN_PASSWORD
  valueFrom:
    secretKeyRef:
      name: keycloak-credentials
      key: password
- name: KC_DB_PASSWORD
  valueFrom:
    secretKeyRef:
      name: keycloak-db-postgresql
      key: password
- name: KC_PROXY
  value: "edge"
- name: KC_FRONTEND_URL
  value: https://sso.janz.digital/auth
- name: JAVA_OPTS_APPEND
  value: >-
    -XX:+UseContainerSupport
    -XX:MaxRAMPercentage=50.0
    -Djava.awt.headless=true
    -Djgroups.dns.query={{ include "keycloak.fullname" . }}-headless

0:
# Could use the above envar, but lets use the quarkus conf file
quarkus.transaction-manager.enable-recovery=true
# quarkus.http.non-application-root-path=/

- name: objectstore
  emptyDir:
    sizeLimit: 100Mi
- name: quarkusproperties
  secret:
    secretName: keycloak-quarkusproperties
    defaultMode: 0777

- mountPath: /ObjectStore
  name: objectstore
- name: quarkusproperties
  mountPath: /opt/keycloak/conf/quarkus.properties
  subPath: quarkus.properties

1:
#!/bin/sh
DNS_LOCAL_CIDRS="local"
IPV4_ENABLED="true"
IPV6_ENABLED="false"
NOT_ROUTED_TO_GATEWAY_CIDRS="10.0.0.0/8 192.168.0.0/16"
VPN_BLOCK_OTHER_TRAFFIC="false"
VPN_INTERFACE="wg0"
VPN_LOCAL_CIDRS="10.0.0.0/8 192.168.0.0/16"
VPN_TRAFFIC_PORT="51820"
VXLAN_GATEWAY_FIRST_DYNAMIC_IP="20"
VXLAN_ID="44"
VXLAN_IPV6_NETWORK="fd60:ca7f:e5d8:42e9"
VXLAN_IP_NETWORK="172.16.1"
VXLAN_PORT="4789"

0:
initContainers:
  - name: init
    securityContext: &sc
      runAsNonRoot: true
      runAsUser: 8737
      runAsGroup: 8737
      allowPrivilegeEscalation: false
      readOnlyRootFilesystem: true
      capabilities:
        drop: ["ALL"]
      seccompProfile:
        type: RuntimeDefault
containers:
  - name: wait
    securityContext: *sc
